==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=来}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
It is shaped like corn or wheat (similar to {{zh-l|*禾}}), symbolising the coming of the crops. Its Old Chinese pronunciation begins with “*''mr-''”. The meaning “come” was originally represented by {{och-l|麥|wheat}}, adding a radical meaning “footprint” or “walk slowly”. Their meanings have interchanged. M-remaining is {{lang|zh|麥}}, l-remaining is {{lang|zh|來}}.

===Etymology===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*la-j ~ ra}}.

===Definitions===
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[come]]; to [[arrive]]
#: {{zh-ant|去}}
#* {{zh-x|我 一會-兒{r} 就 來。|I'll come in a moment.}}
#* {{zh-x|我 不 知道 它 是 從 哪裡 來 的。|I didn't know where it came from.}}
#* [http://wordproject.org/multi/bi_en_cn_py.htm John 1.6]
#*: {{zh-x|有 一 個 人，是 從 神 那裡 差 來 的，名 叫 ^約翰。|There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.}}
# to [[happen]]; to [[occur]]
# to [[do]] {{n-g|(specific meaning depending on the context)}}
# [[since]]
# [[next]]; [[coming]]; [[future]]
#* {{zh-x|來年|next year}}
# {{lb|zh|after a number}} [[about]]; [[approximately]]; [[around]]
# {{n-g|Used after a verb of motion to indicate movement toward the speaker.}}
#* {{zh-x|下來|to come down [compare {{zh-l|下去|to go down}}]}}
#* {{zh-x|進來|to come in}}
# {{n-g|Used before a verb to express volition.}}
# {{n-g|Used with {{zh-l|*不}} or {{zh-l|*得}} to express capability.}}
#: {{zh-x|我 做 不 來 俯臥撐。|I can't do push-ups.}}
# {{n-g|Used after numerals in colloquial lists.}}
# {{n-g|Meaningless particle for rhythmic purposes.}}
# {{surname|lang=zh}}

==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=n|rs=木04|style=ky|shin=来}}

# [[come]]

====Usage notes====
Not used in modern Japanese, except in some names. In regular text, the [[shinjitai]] character {{l|ja|来}} is used instead.

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[らい]] (rai)
|kanon=[[らい]] (rai)
|kun=[[くる|く-る]] (ku-ru), [[きたる|きた-る]] / [[きたる|き-たる]] (kita-ru / ki-taru)
}}

===Etymology 1===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=らい}} {{m|zh|sc=Hani|來}}.

====Pronunciation====
* [[音読み|On'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/ra.i/|[ɽäi]}}

====Prefix====
{{ja-pos|らい|prefix|shin=来}}

# {{kyujitai spelling of|来|lang=ja}} [[next]], [[coming]] (week, year, etc.)
#*: {{ja-usex|'''來'''年、'''來'''週|'''らい'''ねん、 '''らい'''しゅう|'''next''' year, '''next''' week}}
#*: {{ja-usex|'''來'''週月曜日に會いましょう。|'''らい'''しゅう げつようび に あいましょう。|Let's meet Monday '''next'''. / Let's meet this '''coming''' Monday.}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|らい|suffix|shin=来}}

# {{kyujitai spelling of|来|lang=ja}} [[since]], [[in]] (a span of time)
#*: {{ja-usex|三年'''來'''あれを見ていない。|さん ねん '''らい''' あれ を みて いない。|I haven't seen that '''in''' three years / '''since''' three years ago.}}

===Etymology 2===
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=く}}. The verb ''ku'' is one of the few [[monosyllabic]] verb roots in Japanese. This developed into [[来る|''kuru'']] in modern Japanese.

====Pronunciation====
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|/ku/|[kɯᵝ]}}

====Verb====
{{ja-verb|く|type=3|shin=来}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=く|obsolete}} to approach ones position from a remote location: to [[come]]
#: Developed into {{l|ja|來る|tr=[[くる]], ''[[kuru#Japanese|kuru]]''}} in modern Japanese.
